item.description:
Jim J. Zebrowski from the Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc will present a short program called “Backyard Astronomy under Medfield Starry Skies!” at the Medfield Public Library on Tuesday, August 14th 2012 at 7:30 PM. If the weather permits, Jim J. Zebrowski., President of the Aldrich Society will also set up a telescope for observing once the indoor presentation is finished! If the weather permits, outdoor observing will be nearby with objects like Saturn, Mars, Albireo, M57 and M13 possible targets along with starhopping techniques for locating constellations!
Learn all about telescopes!
Discover Amateur Astronomy!
Learn How to use Binoculars for Celestial Observing!
Find out about Starhopping!
Down to Earth Astronomy Tips for Finding Objects
from your Own Backyard!

Parking is available on Main Street (Route 109), behind the Library on Pleasant Street, in the town lot on Janes Avenue (next to Wills Hardware), and behind the Library (can be reached through the Lord’s parking lot on South Street). Please do not park in the Lord’s lot.
item.name: Backyard Astronomy at the Medfield Public Library!
